section.section:
Subject to the hearing provisions of § 5-408 of this subtitle, the Board may deny registration as an apprentice to any applicant, reprimand any individual registered as an apprentice, or suspend or revoke the registration of an individual registered as an apprentice:
for any applicable ground under § 5-314 of this title;
if the applicant or individual fraudulently or deceptively obtains or attempts to obtain registration for the applicant or individual or for another; or
if the applicant or individual fraudulently or deceptively uses a certificate of registration.

Instead of or in addition to reprimanding an individual registered as an apprentice or suspending or revoking a registration, the Board may impose a penalty not exceeding $300 for all violations cited on a single date.
To determine the amount of penalty imposed under this subsection, the Board shall consider:
The Board shall pay any penalty collected under this subsection into the General Fund of the State.

Except as provided in subsection (d) of this section, if the Board finds that a complaint alleges facts that are adequate grounds for action under this section, the Board shall act on the complaint as provided under § 5-408 of this subtitle to deny, suspend, or revoke a certificate of registration, reprimand an apprentice, or assess a penalty.
If the Board does not make the finding, the Board shall dismiss the complaint.

If the Board makes the finding under subsection (c)(1) of this section for a violation that relates to the sanitary practice of cosmetology, the Board shall provide the apprentice an opportunity to correct the alleged violation.

If the apprentice fails to correct each alleged violation within 10 days of written notification of the violation by the Board, the Board shall act on the complaint as provided under § 5-408 of this subtitle.

If the apprentice corrects each alleged violation within 10 days of notice, the Board shall:
dismiss the complaint; and
provide the apprentice written notification of the dismissal.
